page.title: 14A RECONCILER
page.content: Ray Davey's name is familiar in Ulster and to thousands outside the island, because of the work he has done to bring divided Ulster people together. His early life was in Dunmurry, where his father was the Presbyterian minister for many years. He wrote about life in Dunmurry in the twenties in a book. During the war he was a prisoner in Italy and Germany, and after this he became Presbyterian chaplain to the Queen's University.Here he formed a truly ecumenical group and was loved by all. His greatest work was in the formation of the Corrymeela community which brings together all kinds of people, transcending any sect or religion. The community has dissolved much hatred and affected thousands here and abroad.
